dmca.title: [ThePlanet-C2432968E] Abuse by one of your ISP clients
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
-----Original Message-----
From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, January 16, 2007 1:34 AM
To: Copyright
Subject: [ThePlanet-C2432968E] Abuse by one of your ISP clients

helo=bay0-omc1-s30.bay0.hotmail.com; 

MIME element (text/plain)
To Whom it May Concern: 
 
In the past few days I have discovered that when I search my name
("Michael
Pignatella") on Google, AltaVista, Yahoo, etc... the search results
include links to adult sites with which I have absolutely no affiliation
whatsoever.  
  These sites have apparently stolen not only my name but my picture
from a legitimate site, and are for some reason using it within their
site.  As you can imagine, this is very disturbing.  In addition to the
stealing of my image and the unauthorized use of my name, these sites
also attempt to implant trojan horses and viruses to anyone foolish
enough to access them without virus protection software. 
 
The URLs for the offending websites are as follows:  porn-cat.org;
ebun.org; fetish-nylon.org; and xbdsm.org.  According to a Whois search,
you are the ISP for all of these websites.  All of the sites are
registered to Victor Shumer of BWA Ltd, out of Chad. 
 
These websites infringe upon my rights, are libelous and may cause
damage to my reputation, and arguably violate my copyright in my
picture.  This email is to demand that you shut down these sites
immediately.  Please note that I am a lawyer, and should you not take
action to shut these website down, I am prepared to take whatever
actions against your company I deem prudent, including not only
complaining to your state regulators, but filing a lawsuit.  I would
expect that will not be necessary, but as you can understand this abuse
is very disturbing. 
 
I appreciate your attention to this matter. 
 
Sincerely, 
 
Michael Pignatella 
 
_________________________________________________________________
The MSN Entertainment Guide to Golden Globes is here.  Get all the
scoop.
